required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Compare PK, PD and Safety of CKD-381 and D026 in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-label, Multiple-dose, and Crossover Study to Compare Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics and Safety of CKD-381 and D026 in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: A Study to compare pharmacokinetics and safety of CKD-381 and D026 in healthy subjects

primary_outcome.measure: AUCtau,ss(Area under the plasma drug concentration-time curve within a dosing interval at steady state)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation PK for Esomeprazole after multiple dose

primary_outcome.measure: Percent decrease from baseline in integrated gastric acidity for 24-hour interval after 7th dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline versus Multiple dose during 7 days
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation PD for ambulatory 24hr pH monitor

arm_group.description: Period 1: Test drug(CKD-381) Period 2: Reference drug(D026)
Period 1: Reference drug(D026) Period 2: Test drug(CKD-381)

intervention.description: 1 tablet administered before the breakfast during 7 days
1 tablet administered before the breakfast during 7 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Between 19 aged and 50 aged in healthy male adult
2. Body weight more than 55kg
3. Body Mass Index more than 18.5 and under 25
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Have clinically significant disease that hepatobiliary system, kidney, nervous system, immune system, respiratory system, endocrine system, hemato-oncology disease, cardiovascular system or mental illness, or a history of mental disease.
2. Have a gastrointestinal disease history that can effect drug absorption or surgery.
3. Hypersensitivity reaction or clinically significant hypersensitivity reaction in the history of Investigational product, additives or benzimidazole family.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Clinical Pharmacology and Therapeutics, Seoul Nat'l University College of Medicine and Hospital
